output_list.reason: The mintToken function allows unlimited token minting without constraints, enabling the creation of an unbounded supply of tokens.
The transferOwnership function does not include any access control checks, allowing any user to claim ownership and funds.
The transferFrom function does not verify sufficient funds and allowances before transferring tokens, enabling unauthorized transfers.
The PayWinner function relies on a predictable winner selection without secure randomness, enabling exploitation.
The MorphToken function relies on outdated constructor naming conventions prone to typos, enabling unintended exposure of the function as public.
